verses.verse: Abraham <S%H85><s%> took <S%H3947><s%> another <S%H3254><s%> wife, <S%H802><s%> and her name <S%H8034><s%> was Keturah. <S%H6989><s%>
She bore <S%H3205><s%> him Zimran, <S%H2175><s%> Jokshan, <S%H3370><s%> Medan, <S%H4091><s%> Midian, <S%H4080><s%> Ishbak, <S%H3435><s%> and Shuah. <S%H7744><s%>

Jokshan <S%H3370><s%> became the father of Sheba, <S%H7614><s%> and Dedan. <S%H1719><s%> The sons <S%H1121><s%> of Dedan <S%H1719><s%> were Asshurim, <S%H805><s%> Letushim, <S%H3912><s%> and Leummim. <S%H3817><s%>

The sons <S%H1121><s%> of Midian: <S%H4080><s%> Ephah, <S%H5891><s%> Epher, <S%H6081><s%> Hanoch, <S%H2585><s%> Abida, <S%H28><s%> and Eldaah. <S%H420><s%> All these were the children <S%H1121><s%> of Keturah. <S%H6989><s%>
Abraham <S%H85><s%> gave <S%H5414><s%> all that he had to Isaac, <S%H3327><s%>

but to the sons <S%H1121><s%> of Abraham <S%H85><s%>'s concubines, <S%H6370><s%> Abraham <S%H85><s%> gave <S%H5414><s%> gifts. <S%H4979><s%> He sent them away <S%H7971><s%> from Isaac <S%H3327><s%> his son, <S%H1121><s%> while he yet lived, <S%H2416><s%> eastward, <S%H6924><s%> to the east <S%H6924><s%> country. <S%H776><s%>

These are the days <S%H3117><s%> of the years <S%H8141><s%> of Abraham <S%H85><s%>'s life <S%H2416><s%> which he lived: <S%H2425><s%> one hundred <S%H3967><s%> seventy-five <S%H7657><s%> years. <S%H8141><s%>

Abraham <S%H85><s%> gave up the spirit, <S%H1478><s%> and died <S%H4191><s%> in a good <S%H2896><s%> old age, <S%H7872><s%> an old man, <S%H2205><s%> and full <S%H7649><s%> of years, <S%H622><s%> and was gathered to his people. <S%H5971><s%>

Isaac <S%H3327><s%> and Ishmael, <S%H3458><s%> his sons, <S%H1121><s%> buried <S%H6912><s%> him in the cave <S%H4631><s%> of Machpelah, <S%H4375><s%> in the field <S%H7704><s%> of Ephron, <S%H6085><s%> the son <S%H1121><s%> of Zohar <S%H6714><s%> the Hittite, <S%H2850><s%> which is before <S%H6440><s%> Mamre, <S%H4471><s%>

the field <S%H7704><s%> which Abraham <S%H85><s%> purchased <S%H7069><s%> of the children <S%H1121><s%> of Heth. <S%H2845><s%> Abraham <S%H85><s%> was buried <S%H6912><s%> there with Sarah, <S%H8283><s%> his wife. <S%H802><s%>

It happened after <S%H310><s%> the death <S%H4194><s%> of Abraham <S%H85><s%> that God <S%H430><s%> blessed <S%H1288><s%> Isaac, <S%H3327><s%> his son. <S%H1121><s%> Isaac <S%H3327><s%> lived <S%H3427><s%> by <S%H5973><s%> Beer Lahai Roi. <S%H883><s%>

Now this is the history <S%H8435><s%> of the generations <S%H8435><s%> of Ishmael, <S%H3458><s%> Abraham <S%H85><s%>'s son, <S%H1121><s%> whom Hagar <S%H1904><s%> the Egyptian, <S%H4713><s%> Sarah <S%H8283><s%>'s handmaid, <S%H8198><s%> bore to Abraham. <S%H85><s%>

These are the names <S%H8034><s%> of the sons <S%H1121><s%> of Ishmael, <S%H3458><s%> by their names, <S%H8034><s%> according to the order <S%H8435><s%> of their birth: <S%H1060><s%> the firstborn of Ishmael, <S%H3458><s%> Nebaioth, <S%H5032><s%> then Kedar, <S%H6938><s%> Adbeel, <S%H110><s%> Mibsam, <S%H4017><s%>
Mishma, <S%H4927><s%> Dumah, <S%H1746><s%> Massa, <S%H4854><s%>
Hadad, <S%H2316><s%> Tema, <S%H8485><s%> Jetur, <S%H3195><s%> Naphish, <S%H5305><s%> and Kedemah. <S%H6929><s%>

These are the sons <S%H1121><s%> of Ishmael, <S%H3458><s%> and these are their names, <S%H8034><s%> by their villages, <S%H2691><s%> and by their encampments: <S%H2918><s%> twelve <S%H8147><s%> princes, <S%H5387><s%> according to their nations. <S%H523><s%>

These are the years <S%H8141><s%> of the life <S%H2416><s%> of Ishmael: <S%H3458><s%> one <S%H3967><s%> hundred <S%H7970><s%> thirty-seven <S%H7651><s%> years. <S%H8141><s%> He gave up the spirit <S%H1478><s%> and died, <S%H4191><s%> and was gathered <S%H622><s%> to his people. <S%H5971><s%>

They lived <S%H7931><s%> from Havilah <S%H2341><s%> to Shur <S%H7793><s%> that is before <S%H6440><s%> Egypt, <S%H4714><s%> as you go <S%H935><s%> toward Assyria. <S%H804><s%> He lived <S%H5307><s%> opposite <S%H6440><s%> all his relatives. <S%H251><s%>
This is the history <S%H8435><s%> of the generations <S%H8435><s%> of Isaac, <S%H3327><s%> Abraham <S%H85><s%>'s son. <S%H1121><s%> Abraham became the father <S%H3205><s%> of Isaac. <S%H3327><s%>

Isaac <S%H3327><s%> was forty <S%H705><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> old <S%H1121><s%> when he took <S%H3947><s%> Rebekah, <S%H7259><s%> the daughter <S%H1323><s%> of Bethuel <S%H1328><s%> the Syrian <S%H761><s%> of Paddan <S%H6307><s%> Aram, <S%H269><s%> the sister of Laban <S%H3837><s%> the Syrian, <S%H761><s%> to be his wife. <S%H802><s%>

Isaac <S%H3327><s%> entreated <S%H6279><s%> Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> for <S%H5227><s%> his wife, <S%H802><s%> because she was barren. <S%H6135><s%> Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> was entreated <S%H6279><s%> by him, <S%H7259><s%> and Rebekah his wife <S%H802><s%> conceived. <S%H2029><s%>

The children <S%H1121><s%> struggled together <S%H7533><s%> within her. <S%H7130><s%> She said, <S%H559><s%> "If it be so, <S%H2088><s%> why do I live?" She went <S%H3212><s%> to inquire <S%H1875><s%> of Yahweh. <S%H3068><s%>

Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to her, <S%H8147><s%> "Two nations <S%H1471><s%> are in your womb. <S%H990><s%> Two <S%H8147><s%> peoples <S%H3816><s%> will be separated <S%H6504><s%> from your body. <S%H4578><s%> The one people <S%H3816><s%> will be stronger <S%H553><s%> than the other people. <S%H3816><s%> The elder <S%H7227><s%> will serve <S%H5647><s%> the younger. <S%H6810><s%>"
When her days <S%H3117><s%> to be delivered <S%H3205><s%> were fulfilled, <S%H4390><s%> behold, <S%H8380><s%> there were twins in her womb. <S%H990><s%>
The first <S%H7223><s%> came out <S%H3318><s%> red <S%H132><s%> all over, <S%H8181><s%> like a hairy garment. <S%H155><s%> They named <S%H8034><s%> him <S%H7121><s%> Esau. <S%H6215><s%>

After <S%H310><s%> that, <S%H251><s%> his brother came <S%H3318><s%> out, <S%H3318><s%> and his hand <S%H3027><s%> had hold <S%H270><s%> on Esau <S%H6215><s%>'s heel. <S%H6119><s%> He was <S%H7121><s%> named <S%H8034><s%> Jacob. <S%H3290><s%> Isaac <S%H3327><s%> was sixty <S%H8346><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> old <S%H1121><s%> when she bore them. <S%H3205><s%>

The boys <S%H5288><s%> grew. <S%H1431><s%> Esau <S%H6215><s%> was a skillful <S%H3045><s%> hunter, <S%H6718><s%> a man <S%H376><s%> of the field. <S%H7704><s%> Jacob <S%H3290><s%> was a quiet <S%H8535><s%> man, <S%H376><s%> living <S%H3427><s%> in tents. <S%H168><s%>
Now Isaac <S%H3327><s%> loved <S%H157><s%> Esau, <S%H6215><s%> because he ate <S%H6310><s%> his venison. <S%H6718><s%> Rebekah <S%H7259><s%> loved <S%H157><s%> Jacob. <S%H3290><s%>
Jacob <S%H3290><s%> boiled <S%H2102><s%> stew. <S%H5138><s%> Esau <S%H6215><s%> came <S%H935><s%> in from the field, <S%H7704><s%> and he was famished. <S%H5889><s%>

Esau <S%H6215><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to Jacob, <S%H3290><s%> "Please feed <S%H3938><s%> me with <S%H4480><s%> that same <S%H122><s%> red <S%H122><s%> stew, <S%H5889><s%> for I am famished." Therefore his name <S%H8034><s%> was called <S%H7121><s%> Edom. <S%H123><s%>
Jacob <S%H3290><s%> said, <S%H559><s%> "First, <S%H4376><s%> sell me <S%H3117><s%> your birthright. <S%H1062><s%>"
Esau <S%H6215><s%> said, <S%H559><s%> "Behold, <S%H1980><s%> I am about to die. <S%H4191><s%> What good is the birthright to me? <S%H1062><s%>"
Jacob <S%H3290><s%> said, <S%H559><s%> "Swear <S%H7650><s%> to me first. <S%H3117><s%>" He swore <S%H7650><s%> to him. <S%H4376><s%> He sold his birthright <S%H1062><s%> to Jacob. <S%H3290><s%>

Jacob <S%H3290><s%> gave <S%H5414><s%> Esau <S%H6215><s%> bread <S%H3899><s%> and stew <S%H5138><s%> of lentils. <S%H5742><s%> He ate <S%H398><s%> and drank, <S%H8354><s%> rose up, <S%H6965><s%> and went his way. <S%H3212><s%> So Esau <S%H6215><s%> despised <S%H959><s%> his birthright. <S%H1062><s%>
